result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Richard Leonard Rodriguez II was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample within 30 days. 
Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: 185 days jail imposed, 156 days stayed pending successful completion of probation, 29 days jail to serve with good time and 4 days credit. 1st 48 hours without EHM and to commence immediately

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Leonard Rodriguez II

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

1:33 PM Defendant Richard Leonard Rodriguez II in court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Richard Leonard Rodriguez II.  Attorney Kaley Walker in court for State of Wisconsin. ADA walker: guilty to Ct#1 w/3 years probation: 185 days jail, 156 days stayed pending successful completion of probation; 29 days jail; 1st 48 hours in custody, no position on EHM, $2197 fine, lifetime revocation of DL. Atty Nelson and Def agree. Nelson to argue length of probation. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights  Def pleas guilty to Ct#1. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#1; dismisses Ct#2. ADA Walker addresses sentencing. Atty Nelson addresses sentencing and argues for shorter term of probation. Court orders S/W 3 years probation; 185 days jail imposed, stays 156 days pending successful completion of probation, 29 days jail (with 4 days credit and good time) w/1st 48 hours commencing immediately and  without EHM, EHM allowed on Thursday September 29 at 10:am, $2197 fine, lifetime revocation of DL, Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. Defendant is remanded to the PCSO. 1:54
Plea hearing on September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:34 AM Defendant Richard Leonard Rodriguez in Court with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Set for Plea.  Atty. Nelson requests that Plea be rescheduled as he was unable to speak with Jail re: EHM requirements.  ADA Walker does not object.  Court will grant rescheduling.  Court directs Defendant to be prepared before next hearing.  Adjourned at 11:37 AM  Plea hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on July 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif
Pre-trial conference on April 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Information filed with the Court.  DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 4:02 pm.

3:57 PM Defendant Richard Leonard Rodriguez II appears in Court, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Nelson states this will be a waiver. Court questions and reviews DE's rights. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH.  The Court finds probable cause and binds DE over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on February 28, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

3:08 PM Defendant Richard Leonard Rodriguez II appears in custody, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walker is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/condition of AS, no objection. Court so orders. DE does qualify for PD. Court confirms address and phone number. Was in the military. Court adjourned at 3:15 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
